title: Overlooked impact of surface hydroxylation on the solubility of less-soluble compounds: a case study of CeO2
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EN00014E, Paper
Tatiana V. Plakhova, Anna Yu. Romanchuk, Anastasia D. Konyukhova, Irina F. Seregina, Alexander E. Baranchikov, Roman D. Svetogorov, Maxwell W. Terban, Vladimir K. Ivanov, Stepan N. Kalmykov
CeO2 surface is crucial for dissolution process. Untreated nanoparticles are more soluble than dried ones due to their hydrated state. Dried CeO2 solubility increases as the surface returns to a hydrated state, ensuring long-term stability.
